fine_dining.name: L'Atlantide 1874
signature_dishes: Lobster with citrus and shellfish juice
fine_dining.atmosphere: Elegant contemporary dining room with Loire River views
fine_dining.booking_tips: Book at least three weeks in advance, request window table for river views
fine_dining.local_tips: Chef Jean-Yves Guého celebrates local seafood with innovative techniques

fine_dining.name: La Mare aux Oiseaux
signature_dishes: Local fish with Brière marsh herbs
fine_dining.atmosphere: Rustic-elegant with natural materials and marsh views
fine_dining.booking_tips: Book at least one month in advance, worth the short drive from Nantes
fine_dining.local_tips: Located in the Brière regional park with a unique focus on local marsh ingredients

fine_dining.name: Restaurant Lulu Rouget
fine_dining.atmosphere: Intimate contemporary space with open kitchen
fine_dining.booking_tips: Book at least two weeks in advance, opt for the surprise tasting menu
fine_dining.local_tips: Chef Ludovic Pouzelgues trained with Alain Passard and creates truly innovative cuisine

fine_dining.name: Le Manoir de la Boulaie
fine_dining.atmosphere: Elegant château dining room with garden views
fine_dining.booking_tips: Book at least three weeks in advance, worth the drive from Nantes
fine_dining.local_tips: Chef Thierry Drapeau creates artistic presentations inspired by the local landscape

fine_dining.name: Song
signature_dishes: Tasting menu blending French technique with Asian flavors
fine_dining.atmosphere: Sleek modern interior with minimalist Asian touches
fine_dining.booking_tips: Reserve at least two weeks in advance, counter seating available for kitchen views
fine_dining.local_tips: Chef Song creates a unique fusion of French technique with Korean and Japanese influences

casual_dining.name: La Cigale
casual_dining.atmosphere: Historic Art Nouveau brasserie with ornate decor (since 1895)
casual_dining.booking_tips: Book several days ahead, especially for weekend meals
casual_dining.local_tips: A Nantes institution with stunning Belle Époque interiors, worth visiting even just for coffee

casual_dining.name: Crêperie Heb Ken
signature_dishes: Galette complète (buckwheat crêpe with ham, egg, cheese)
casual_dining.atmosphere: Cozy traditional crêperie with Breton decor
casual_dining.booking_tips: Arrive early to avoid waiting, especially at dinner
casual_dining.local_tips: One of the most authentic Breton crêperies in Nantes, serving traditional buckwheat galettes

casual_dining.name: Le 1
casual_dining.atmosphere: Contemporary bistro with simple elegant decor
casual_dining.booking_tips: Book a few days in advance, lunch menu offers great value
casual_dining.local_tips: Chef Julien Moreau creates well-executed bistro classics with modern touches

casual_dining.name: La Raffinerie
casual_dining.atmosphere: Industrial-chic former sugar refinery with high ceilings
casual_dining.booking_tips: Book for dinner, lunch is more casual, good for groups
casual_dining.local_tips: Trendy spot that transforms from casual lunch spot to vibrant evening venue with DJs

casual_dining.name: Pickles
casual_dining.atmosphere: Small, intimate bistro with personal service
casual_dining.booking_tips: Book at least a week ahead, especially for weekends
casual_dining.local_tips: Run by British chef Dominic Quirke, offering excellent value lunch menus with market-fresh ingredients

casual_dining.name: Le Nid
casual_dining.atmosphere: Panoramic bar/café atop Tour Bretagne with bird-themed design
casual_dining.booking_tips: Come for the view rather than the food, expect lines on weekends
casual_dining.local_tips: More about the spectacular 360° views of Nantes than the simple menu

casual_dining.name: Crêperie Le Vieux Quimper
casual_dining.atmosphere: Traditional with Breton decorations and authentic atmosphere
casual_dining.booking_tips: Book in advance for dinner, specify if you prefer indoor or outdoor seating
casual_dining.local_tips: One of Nantes' most respected crêperies, focusing on high-quality ingredients

casual_dining.name: Sépia
casual_dining.atmosphere: Modern, minimalist dining room with open kitchen
casual_dining.booking_tips: Book a week in advance, excellent value lunch menu
casual_dining.local_tips: Chef Xavier Thuaud creates precise, modern dishes with excellent price-quality ratio

street_food.name: Marché de Talensac
street_food.local_tips: Nantes' largest and most important covered market, excellent for sampling local produce

street_food.name: Lieu Unique Café
street_food.local_tips: Trendy café in the former LU biscuit factory, with canal-side terrace in summer

street_food.name: Bouffay District Food Stalls
street_food.local_tips: The historic heart of Nantes offers many quick food options, especially popular with students

street_food.name: La Fraiseraie
street_food.local_tips: Famous regional specialty from nearby Pornic, their strawberry ice cream is a must-try

street_food.name: Maison Grimaud
specialties: Fouées (small puffed breads filled to order)
street_food.local_tips: Try the fouées, a specialty from the Loire Valley rarely found elsewhere

street_food.name: Provost
street_food.local_tips: Historic confectionery shop making traditional Nantes candies since 1920

coffee_shops.name: Café Félix
coffee_shops.atmosphere: Bright minimalist space with plants and large windows
coffee_shops.local_tips: One of Nantes' pioneering specialty coffee shops with excellent brunch options

coffee_shops.name: Owl
coffee_shops.atmosphere: Cozy, Nordic-inspired design with wooden elements
coffee_shops.local_tips: Excellent coffee paired with healthy, creative food options

coffee_shops.name: Flower
coffee_shops.food_options: Breakfast options, vegetarian and vegan choices
coffee_shops.local_tips: Part café, part plant shop with a beautiful atmosphere and quality coffee

coffee_shops.name: Gentlemen Baristas
coffee_shops.local_tips: English owners bring unique perspective to the Nantes coffee scene

coffee_shops.name: La Sarazine Cantine
coffee_shops.atmosphere: Warm industrial space with communal tables
coffee_shops.food_options: Full lunch menu with vegetarian options
coffee_shops.local_tips: Popular with local workers for lunch but also good for working remotely

bars.name: Le Nid
bars.atmosphere: Artistic space with bird theme and 360° views of Nantes
bars.local_tips: The giant bird sculpture by artist Jean Jullien is iconic; go for the views rather than the drinks

bars.name: John McByrne
bars.atmosphere: Traditional pub atmosphere with live music
bars.local_tips: Popular expat hangout with regular live music and sports screenings

bars.name: Le Lieu Unique
bars.atmosphere: Industrial-chic in former LU biscuit factory with canal-side terrace
bars.local_tips: Cultural hub with exhibitions, performances and a great bar scene, especially in summer

bars.name: Little Atlantique Brewery
bars.local_tips: Local microbrewery with taproom on the Loire riverbank, excellent outdoor space

bars.name: Le Café du Commerce
bars.atmosphere: Classic French bistro with vintage elements
bars.local_tips: Excellent selection of natural wines and knowledgeable staff

bars.name: La Civelle
bars.atmosphere: Charming setting in fishing village with Loire views
bars.local_tips: Located in picturesque Trentemoult across the Loire, accessible by boat shuttle from Nantes

food_tours.name: Taste of Nantes Walking Tour
food_tours.focus: Local Nantes specialties and Breton influences
food_tours.booking_tips: Morning tours recommended to experience the market at its best

food_tours.name: Muscadet Wine Country Tour
food_tours.booking_tips: Includes transportation from Nantes, wear comfortable shoes for vineyard walking

food_tours.name: Gourmet Bouffay District Tour
food_tours.booking_tips: Afternoon tours available, focuses on the historic heart of the city

food_tours.name: Maritime Flavors of Nantes
food_tours.booking_tips: Includes boat transportation on the Loire, seafood focus

cooking_classes.name: L'Atelier de Laurence
cooking_classes.cuisine_focus: Traditional Breton and Loire Valley cuisine
includes: Meal with local cider or wine
cooking_classes.booking_tips: Classes for all levels, focus on regional specialties

cooking_classes.name: Atelier des Chefs Nantes
cooking_classes.booking_tips: Express lunch format available, larger classes but professional setting

cooking_classes.name: Cuisine et Moi
cooking_classes.booking_tips: Small-group experience in home kitchen setting with market visit

markets.name: Marché de Talensac
highlights: Fresh seafood, produce, and prepared foods
markets.local_tips: The heart of food shopping in Nantes, busiest on weekend mornings

markets.name: Marché de la Petite Hollande
markets.local_tips: One of the city's largest markets, only on Saturdays but worth planning around

markets.name: Marché Biologique de la Place Saint-Felix
markets.local_tips: The place for organic and sustainable products, popular with eco-conscious locals

markets.name: Marché de Trentemoult
markets.local_tips: Worth combining with lunch in this colorful former fishing village, accessible by boat shuttle

spring: White asparagus from the Loire Valley
First of the season Muscadet wine
winter: Breton Kig Ha Farz (meat and buckwheat dumpling stew)
